intro: Xanthophyllum curtisii, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Xanthophyllum curtisii has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems. Its unique coloration and habitat make it a notable species in botanical studies.
